title: Khachapuri (Georgian Cheese Bread)
steps: In bowl of stand mixer, combine salt, yeast, sugar, and flour.
Heat water and milk to about 115°F (46°C). Pour into bowl of dry ingredients.
Knead with hook attachment until close to smooth and elastic.
Add oil and knead for another minute.
Drizzle olive oil into a deep bowl. Place dough inside, cover with plastic wrap, and set in warm place until doubled in size (about 1 hour).
Press into dough a few times. Cover with plastic wrap again and let sit in warm place for another 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, combine farmers cheese, feta, and mozzarella in a bowl.
Remove dough and place on floured surface. Cut into 4 equal pieces.
Roll each piece into a 9-inch circle. Roll 2 opposite sides toward the center to create boat shape. Pinch corners together.
Transfer khachapuri onto baking sheet lined with greased parchment paper.
Stuff each khachapuri with cheese mixture.
Beat 1 egg with 1 tsp water. Brush dough with egg wash.
Bake in preheated 450°F (230°C) oven for about 15 minutes until crust is golden brown.
Make a 3-inch well in center of each khachapuri with back of spoon. Drop 1 egg into each well.
Stick small pieces of butter into the cheese.
Return to oven and bake for another 5-6 minutes. Egg white should be white but still runny.
When serving, mix cheese and egg with a fork. Serve immediately.
notes: Volume conversions: 1 tsp salt ≈ 5g, 1 tsp yeast ≈ 7g, 1 tbsp sugar ≈ 12g, 3½ cups flour ≈ 420g, 1 cup water ≈ 240g, ½ cup milk ≈ 120g, 1 tbsp oil ≈ 14g, 1½ cups farmers cheese ≈ 180g, 1½ cups mozzarella ≈ 170g, 1½ cups feta ≈ 180g, 4 eggs ≈ 200g, 1 egg ≈ 50g
Egg will continue to cook in hot cheese after removing from oven
Serve immediately while hot and cheese is melted
